intro: [WRONG START] Astragalus zachlensis var. bludlensis, commonly known as the Bludan Astragalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its erect stems and small, yellowish-pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval leaflets that help reduce water loss. This variant is native to specific regions in the Middle East and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche.
